## Wiz is a hybrid company rooted in flexibility.

Employees can choose to work from one of our global offices, fully remote, or a mix of the two.

## Wiz Values

We speak the truth, lead by example, and hold ourselves accountable to the highest possible standards of execution. It's how we build our product - and how we build trust with customers, partners, and each other. Here are our values below:

- ![](/_next/image?url=%2Fimages%2Fcareers%2Fvalues-truth.svg&w=3840&q=75)

- ![](/_next/image?url=%2Fimages%2Fcareers%2Fvalues-win.svg&w=3840&q=75)

  ##### Act confident, stay humble

## What our team loves about Wiz

![](/_next/image?url=%2Fimages%2Fcareers%2Femployee-poster-aner-reiner.webp&w=3840&q=75)

“Being surrounded by the best team out there and the core belief to take action towards our values is what makes Wiz so special. The openness and transparency across the entire company is what makes our culture so unique. Oh, and the view from the NYC office in unmatched...”

Aner ReinerDeal Desk Lead

![](/_next/image?url=%2Fimages%2Fcareers%2Femployee-poster-miles-silva.webp&w=3840&q=75)

“The best part about working here is the people. I love working with all of the incredible teammates that support me, challenge me, and make me smile. I don't think you'll be able to find a better team anywhere else, because the best team is here.”

Miles SilvaSenior IT Technician

![](/_next/image?url=%2Fimages%2Fcareers%2Femployee-poster-naomi-lane.webp&w=3840&q=75)

Naomi LaneAccount Executive

Phishing warning

Scammers may create e-mail addresses or web sites to impersonate Wiz employees. Communications from our Talent Acquisition wizards will only originate from Wiz employees with @wiz.io email addresses.The websites where jobs at Wiz will be posted are:

- [www.wiz.io/careers](/careers)
- <https://www.linkedin.com/company/wizsecurity/jobs>

Our recruiting processes will not ask you to provide financial information, including but not limited to:

- Social Security or tax identification number
- Credit card numbers or other banking information

You can report suspicious recruiting related messages by forwarding the email to security@wiz.io

# People Analytics Specialist

### Tel Aviv | IL HR & HRIS

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY:**

We’re looking for a People Analytics Specialist to join us and spread the power of Wiz. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data on workforce trends to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making across the HR function.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Collect and maintain accurate employee data from various HR systems (e.g., Workday, Greenhouse).
- Analyze HR data related to recruitment, workforce planning, turnover, compensation, benefits, and performance.
- Develop and deliver reports and dashboards to track key HR performance indicators (KPIs) and business trends.
- Manage and analyze employee leveling data to ensure consistent application of job leveling across the organization.
- Provide insights into compensation trends, including global market analysis, benchmarking, and support during annual merit cycles.
- Collaborate with HR business partners and organizational leaders to provide data-driven insights that identify trends in employee behavior, retention, and engagement.
- Work with HRIS team to enhance the functionality of HR systems and tools.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- 3+ years of experience in people analytics, HR data analysis, or a similar role.
- Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering and Management, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
- Advanced proficiency in Excel.
- Experience working with HRIS systems (e.g., Workday, Hi-Bob) and data analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
- Familiarity with HR metrics, including turnover rates, time-to-hire and employee engagement.
- Excellent communication skills to present data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
- Full professional fluency (written and verbal) in both Hebrew and English.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with [Wiz's Privacy Policy.](https://www.wiz.io/legal/privacy)

# Solutions Support Engineer, Japan

### Remote - Japan | Support

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**  

As a Solutions Support Engineer, you will be a part of a global team responsible for providing outstanding technical support experience. In this role, you will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and when needed, creating solutions for customers while scaling our support offering using coding and scripting.  

 

 **WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

- Responsible for technical customer support experience within the Wiz product

- Own, troubleshoot and solve customer technical issues, using collaboration, troubleshooting best practices and transparency within and across teams

- Identify cases that require escalation (either technically or strategically)

- Create, maintain, and coordinate incident management requests to product or engineering

- Design and implement solutions that scale the support offering through automations

- Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours, holiday, weekend support coverage

 

 **WHAT YOU’LL BRING**  

- Fluency in Japanese

- 5+ years of hands-on, technical experience in customer support, technical support, system administration, or related customer-facing role

- A minimum of 2+ years experience with Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP)

- Experience in reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, Python, Shell, JavaScript, JSON

- Proficiency with command-line tools and Linux operating system environments

- Experience with Kubernetes, system virtualization, on-prem and/or hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity and security systems, cloud monitoring and logging, as well as local and cloud storage

- Familiar with security frameworks or tools

- Excellent organizational and project management skills

- Fast learner, natural curiosity, and love of technology

 

 **NICE TO HAVE** 

- Experience with DevOps technologies

- Familiar with REST API's or GraphQL

- Knowledge of basic web technologies (e.g., HTTP, HTML, DNS)

- Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing)

- Understanding of relational databases

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with [Wiz's Privacy Policy.](https://www.wiz.io/legal/privacy)

# Regional Director, Enterprise Sales (France)

### Remote - France | Field Sales

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY:**

We are looking for an experienced and motivated sales leader to join Wiz. In this role, you will report to the RVP of Sales, France. As a Regional Director of Sales, you will manage a team of sales executives in a defined geographical territory. You will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive sales strategy that aligns with the company's goals and objectives. You will also collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure customer success and drive business growth. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:** 

- Manage a team of account executives each responsible for a specific geographical territory outlined and defined by Wiz
- Demonstrate an intimate understanding of Wiz Cloud Security Solutions and their value to our customers
- Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy that aligns with the company's goals and objectives
- Identify new business opportunities and establish relationships with potential clients to expand the customer base
- Collaborate with marketing, product development, and solutions engineering teams to ensure a unified approach to sales and customer service
- Analyze sales data and metrics to measure performance and identify areas for improvement
- Set performance goals for the sales team and provide ongoing coaching and feedback to drive individual and team success
- Develop and maintain relationships with key customers to ensure long-term partnerships and customer satisfaction
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in sales and use this knowledge to inform sales strategy and tactics
- Manage the sales pipeline, forecast sales, and report on sales performance to executive leadership

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**  

- 5+ years' experience managing and leading a team of 4+ enterprise account executives
- 4+ years' sales experience of complex cloud or security
- Proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving revenue growth
- Excellent leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and inspire a team
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships with clients and internal stakeholders
- Ability to analyze sales data and metrics to inform strategy and identify areas for improvement
- Knowledge of sales and marketing best practices and industry trends
- Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with the ability to adapt quickly to changing circumstances

# Senior Solutions Engineer - SEA

### Remote - Singapore | SE

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

As a **Senior** **Solutions Engineer**, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers in SEA region, reporting to the regional Senior Solutions Engineering Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers’ view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 

- Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.

- Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards, product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.

- Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).

- Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.

- Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meetups, and industry events.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING** 

- Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers

- Mastered the technical sales process

- Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model

- Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers

- Cloud security experience

- AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience

- Network engineering experience

- Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge

- Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks

- Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools

- SaaS experience

- Awareness of the CI/CD process
- Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with [Wiz's Privacy Policy.](https://www.wiz.io/legal/privacy)

# Senior Partner Solutions Architect - GSI (Central US Remote)

### Dallas, Texas | SE

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

As a Sr. Partner Solutions Architect, you will be part of the sales team responsible for supporting our GSI Partners, reporting to the Manager, Partner Solutions Architecture. You will work closely with partner facing account reps, and directly with our partners to build and execute the Wiz + Partner technical strategy and solutions, from the ground up.   

As the go-to technical expert you will help partners rethink how they approach cloud security and how they set a preference with customers for the Wiz + Partner solution. You will be the trusted technical advisor to your partners for all things related to cloud security across: AWS, Azure, GCP, and other CSPs.   

At Wiz, we are passionate about technical sales and helping our partners and their customers achieve maximum value from our solution. We believe this all starts with a team effort working very closely with all resources available at Wiz and by teaming with the best partners in the world.   

**LOCATION**

Candidates must be located in New Jersey or Dallas. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

- Deep expertise in building and delivering technical results and solutions with national security (reselling) partners.
- Ability to deliver world class demo and training experience to our GSI Partners.
- Excellence in communication and have experience of speaking at conferences
- Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners building a technical business delivery model.
- Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at Technology Partners.
- **Ability to travel 50%**

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**  

- Cloud security experience.
- AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience.
- Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge.
- DevOps experience and familiar with CI/CD process.
- Understanding of: cloud identity, access, certificates., and keys.

**BONUS POINTS**  

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools.
- SaaS Selling experience.
- CSP Certifications.
- Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks.

**Benefits** 

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location. 

**Health & Welfare Benefits** 

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation.

Our priority is building a secure infrastructure for their cloud environments. We do that by learning their business. We ask questions. We listen. We help educate. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 

- Lead with curiosity to understand our customer’s complex business problems

- Demonstrate an intimate understanding of Wiz Cloud Security Solutions and their value to our customers for our cloud segment

- Align with Wiz partner ecosystem to optimize market opportunity

- Maintain accurate pipeline management with expert-level forecasting

- Build effective working relationships with Solutions Engineering, Customer Success, Product, Marketing, Delivery, and Executive teams to ensure strategy alignment and achieve company objectives

 **WHAT YOU’LL BRING** 

- Minimum 5 years closing experience in the cloud/security space in South India, ideally in a majority hunting role

- Proven track record of selling in a competitive market

- Experience in a hypergrowth/start-up organization

- Ability to build great internal partnerships with key business units and their stakeholders

- A consultative and professional approach to engaging with customers

- Ability to manage multiple opportunities in various stages

- A proven track record managing accounts in cloud or cybersecurity ecosystem to elevate the business

- Resilience, adaptability, flexibility, ability to be a team player

# Public Sector Network Architect (East Coast)

### Remote - USA | Public Sector

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

We’re looking for a Public Sector Network Architect to join us in spreading the power of Wiz. Wiz is looking to change how Federal Agencies/Customers look at risk in the Cloud. We need someone who wants to help drive this vision by working on the Public Sector Architecture team, guiding Wiz through future FedRAMP, DoD and other Public Sector initiatives. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Help guide Wiz through its DISA authorization journey!

- Act as the Cloud Network Security SME for all matters related to network security across AWS, Azure, and GCP.

- Perform architecture reviews and provide federal architecture requirements to help bring new features to Wiz4Gov.

- Ownership and crafting of detailed diagrams that align with FedRAMP ABD, NFD and DFD requirements, using tools like LucidChart, Visio, etc.

- Help test and validate new features to see their value for customer’s as well as help Wiz meet its own security and compliance goals.

- Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders, including DevOps teams, engineering teams, compliance officers, public sector operations and auditors, to address security-related concerns and make recommendations for improvements.

- Provide technical input into the development of System Security Plans (SSP), working with third-party assessment organizations (3PAOs) to achieve new authorizations, implement significant changes, etc.

- Stay up to date with the latest FedRAMP, DISA and NIST guidelines and ensure that systems and processes adhere to these standards, addressing any compliance issues promptly.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- 4+ years of experience working as a Federal Cloud Network Architect/Engineer or Federal Network Security Architect/Engineer in AWS (other clouds a plus!).

- Intimate understanding of the DoD CC SRG in relation to the BCAP connection process, DoD PKI, DNS, and other technical requirements.

- **Firsthand experience** designing architecture in public cloud environments around the DoD CC SRG technical requirements and guiding a CSP (SaaS preferred) through an IL4 or IL5 ATO.

- Expertise architecting networking solutions in public cloud using cloud native services, while following cloud security best practices.

- Hands-on experience with cloud native environments utilizing containers (Kubernetes), microservices, IaC (infrastructure as code) and configuration management tools.

- Familiarity with CI/CD, GitOPs and automated build, test, and release processes.

- A strong sense of taking ownership for projects and leading them from start to finish.

- Ability to translate compliance requirements to technical outcomes.

- Ability to think outside the box when working with compliance frameworks by implementing technical solutions that meet the spirit of controls, vs. the written guidance.

- Knowledge of and ability to evaluate controls and requirements against NIST 800-53, DoD CC SRG, DISA STIGs etc.

- Knowledge of FIPS and other encryption methodologies needed to meet federal requirements.

- A thirst to use Wiz and learn everything the product can do.

*Candidates must meet EAR part 772 and ITAR 120.15 definition of a U.S. person (Any individual who is granted U.S. citizenship; or any individual who is granted U.S. permanent residence (green card holder); or any individual who is granted status as a “protected person”) and that they reside in the contiguous United States.*

#LI-Remote

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location.

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation. 

The annual base salary range for this full-time position is listed below.

$184,000—$253,000 USD

# Solutions Support Engineer, Weekend, 1st Shift, US-East

### Remote - USA | Support

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY** 

As a Solutions Support Engineer, you will be a part of a global team responsible for providing outstanding technical support experience. In this role, you will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and, when needed, creating solutions for customers while scaling our support offering using coding and scripting. 

 **WHAT YOU'LL DO** 

- Responsible for technical customer support experience within the Wiz product
- Own, troubleshoot, and solve customer technical issues using collaboration, troubleshooting best practices, and transparency within and across teams
- Identify cases that require escalation (either technically or strategically)
- Create, maintain, and coordinate incident management requests to product or engineering
- Design and implement solutions that scale the support offering through automation
- Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours, holiday, and weekend support coverage
- This is a 1st shift position and the schedule is Saturday - Wednesday, 9am - 6pm ET

 **WHAT YOU'LL BRING** 

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems, or the equivalent industry experience and certifications.
- 2+ years of hands-on, technical experience in customer support, technical support, system administration, or related customer-facing role
- A minimum of 1+ year experience with Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP)
- Experience in reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, Python, Shell, JavaScript, JSON
- Proficiency with command-line tools and Linux operating system environments
- Experience with Kubernetes, system virtualization, on-prem and/or hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity and security systems, cloud monitoring, and logging, as well as local and cloud storage
- Familiar with security frameworks or tools
- Excellent organizational and project management skills
- Fast learner, natural curiosity, and love of technology

 **NICE TO HAVE**

- Experience with DevOps technologies
- Familiar with REST APIs or GraphQL
- Knowledge of basic web technologies (e.g., HTTP, HTML, DNS)
- Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing)
- Understanding of relational databases

*Candidates must meet EAR part 772 and ITAR 120.15 definition of a U.S. person (Any individual who is granted U.S. citizenship; or any individual who is granted U.S. permanent residence (green card holder); or any individual who is granted status as a “protected person”) and that they reside in the contiguous United States.*

- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process.

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. **SUMMARY**

We’re looking for a **Talent Acquisition Partner** to join us in spreading the power of Wiz by identifying and attracting top talent.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Manage the full life cycle of the hiring process.
- Identify and implement efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.
- Source a diverse technical pipeline using traditional and non-traditional channels to identify the best talent.
- Walk candidates through our process with up-to-date communication and top-notch experience.
- Partner with hiring managers to understand their business objectives and hiring needs.
- Create a great recruiting experience for all candidates.

# SEO Manager

### Remote - USA | Performance Marketing

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

We are seeking a dynamic full-stack SEO Manager who thrives in all areas of SEO, but has a deep love for managing content generation engines. This role sits within the digital marketing org and will collaborate with counterparts in paid search, web, and CRO.

The primary focus of this role is on execution; you believe in getting things done. The ideal candidate is not afraid to get their hands dirty—whether it's rewriting headings, managing link acquisition, adding dozens of internal links, or tackling technical SEO tasks, you are eager to do whatever it takes to grow the business. Traffic growth is fun, but the true north star for this position is organic search’s contribution to opportunities and pipeline growth.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Profitably execute forward-looking SEO strategies that improve full funnel brand visibility to outpace competitors and drive conversions and pipeline.
- Create content briefs that provide clear direction to agencies/writers on how to structure articles that exceed our competitors in terms of value, while also aligning with Wiz’s unique philosophy on cloud security.
- Capture and maintain high positions in the SERPs by regularly performing on-page optimizations on existing content for title tags, meta descriptions, keyword optimization, and content structure based on your monitoring and analysis of ranking fluctuations.
- Proactively identify opportunities to optimize website structure, URL hierarchy, schema markup, and internal linking for improved crawlability and indexing.
- Manage off-page SEO activities to build a high-quality backlink profile that surpasses competitors, increasing website authority and organic traffic.
- International SEO & Localization Strategy: Identify high-impact pages for localization, collaborate cross-functionally with the localization team, and monitor performance metrics to ensure content ranks and converts in international markets.
- Develop A/B tests to identify new tactics to squeeze more leads and pipeline out of our SEO traffic.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams including external agencies, web developers, digital marketers, and sales teams to integrate SEO best practices across all channels.
- Stay updated on the latest SEO trends, algorithm updates, and industry best practices; including how to leverage AI in our SEO workflows to improve efficiency.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- 5+ years of experience managing SEO projects, with a proven track record of success in driving traffic growth, opportunities, and pipeline.
- Experience scaling SEO for growth-stage businesses using product-led and content-led strategies.
- Ceaseless curiosity for SEO and demand generation, actively participating in online communities, subscribing to newsletters, and brainstorming with peers.
- You’re not afraid to challenge the status quo and bring your own insights to the test in order to stay ahead of the curve.
- Eagerness to understand the customer and the role of search in their buying journey.
- Demonstrated project management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
- Basic ability to work with  HTML, CSS, and JS as it relates to SEO.
- Ability to clearly articulate the value of an SEO initiative to project stakeholders. You know the optimal balance of SEO-speak and business-speak.
- In-depth knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO best practices.
- Proficiency in SEO tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, and Sitebulb.

**Nice-to-Haves**

- Experience preferably in an Enterprise SaaS company
- Familiarity with cyber security/DevOps space
- Strong understanding of international SEO strategies
- Deep understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other front-end web programming languages

**Benefits** 

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location. 

**Health & Welfare Benefits** 

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation. 

The annual base salary range for this full-time position is listed below.

US Base Pay Range

$120,000—$165,000 USD

# Cloud Networking Analyst

### London, UK | Product Management & Ops

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

We’re looking for a **Cloud Networking Analyst** to join the **Product team** and spread the power of Wiz. In this role, you’ll play a key part in safeguarding our customers’ cloud environments from cyber threats by expanding the Wiz’s cloud network modeling infrastructure. Using Infrastructure as Code, you’ll model complex environments, analyze networking relationships between components, and map their connectivity within Wiz.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO** :

- Analyze cloud networking services such as API Gateways, Load Balancers, state-of-the-art Kubernetes frameworks, and configuration files of services such as nginx and Envoy.
- Use Infrastructure as Code to simulate complex network environments.
- Use Python to model the relationship between the different networking components and connectivity flow in Wiz.
- Stay current with the latest technologies and industry trends.
- Implement customer requests and industry standards to position Wiz as a market leader.
- Collaborate with our Research and Backend teams.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING:**

- Strong knowledge of networking concepts in cloud infrastructure.
- Experience using Terraform to build complex architectures leveraging cloud services and container services such as Kubernetes.
- 3+ years of experience in Python development with a strong portfolio of projects.
- Hands-on proficiency in Linux, Windowås, Git, Python, Bash, Docker, Kubernetes, PowerShell, and a strong understanding of the OSI model.
- Self-motivated and capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team.
- Strong communication skills.
- Advantage - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field or 3+ more years of experience as a DevOps Engineer.

# Solutions Support Engineer, Weekend 1st shift, US-West

### Austin, Texas; Dallas, Texas; Denver, Colorado; Houston, Texas; Los Angeles, California; Portland, Oregon; San Francisco Bay Area; Seattle, Washington | Support

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY** 

As a Solutions Support Engineer, you will be a part of a global team responsible for providing outstanding technical support experience. In this role, you will troubleshoot technical problems for customers with a mix of debugging, networking, system administration, updating documentation, and, when needed, creating solutions for customers while scaling our support offering using coding and scripting. 

 **WHAT YOU'LL DO** 

- Responsible for technical customer support experience within the Wiz product
- Own, troubleshoot, and solve customer technical issues using collaboration, troubleshooting best practices, and transparency within and across teams
- Identify cases that require escalation (either technically or strategically)
- Create, maintain, and coordinate incident management requests to product or engineering
- Design and implement solutions that scale the support offering through automation
- Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours, holiday, and weekend support coverage
- The schedule for this role is Saturday - Wednesday 9:00am - 6:00 PM PT

 **WHAT YOU'LL BRING** 

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems, or the equivalent industry experience and certifications.
- 2+ years of hands-on, technical experience in customer support, technical support, system administration, or related customer-facing role
- A minimum of 1+ year experience with Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP)
- Experience in reading or debugging code in one or more of the following: Java, Python, Shell, JavaScript, JSON
- Proficiency with command-line tools and Linux operating system environments
- Experience with Kubernetes, system virtualization, on-prem and/or hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity and security systems, cloud monitoring, and logging, as well as local and cloud storage
- Familiar with security frameworks or tools
- Excellent organizational and project management skills
- Fast learner, natural curiosity, and love of technology

 **NICE TO HAVE**

- Experience with DevOps technologies
- Familiar with REST APIs or GraphQL
- Knowledge of basic web technologies (e.g., HTTP, HTML, DNS)
- Understanding of networking fundamentals (e.g., TCP/IP, Routing, VPNs, VLANs, Peering, Load Balancing)
- Understanding of relational databases

*Candidates must meet EAR part 772 and ITAR 120.15 definition of a U.S. person (Any individual who is granted U.S. citizenship; or any individual who is granted U.S. permanent residence (green card holder); or any individual who is granted status as a “protected person”) and that they reside in the contiguous United States.*

# Senior Partner Solutions Architect - GSI (East Coast Remote)

### New Jersey | SE

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

As a Sr. Partner Solutions Architect, you will be part of the sales team responsible for supporting our GSI Partners, reporting to the Manager, Partner Solutions Architecture. You will work closely with partner facing account reps, and directly with our partners to build and execute the Wiz + Partner technical strategy and solutions, from the ground up.   

As the go-to technical expert you will help partners rethink how they approach cloud security and how they set a preference with customers for the Wiz + Partner solution. You will be the trusted technical advisor to your partners for all things related to cloud security across: AWS, Azure, GCP, and other CSPs.   

At Wiz, we are passionate about technical sales and helping our partners and their customers achieve maximum value from our solution. We believe this all starts with a team effort working very closely with all resources available at Wiz and by teaming with the best partners in the world.   

**LOCATION**

Candidates must be located in New Jersey or Dallas. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

- Deep expertise in building and delivering technical results and solutions with national security (reselling) partners.
- Ability to deliver world class demo and training experience to our GSI Partners.
- Excellence in communication and have experience of speaking at conferences
- Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners building a technical business delivery model.
- Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at Technology Partners.
- **Ability to travel 50%**

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**  

- Cloud security experience.
- AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience.
- Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge.
- DevOps experience and familiar with CI/CD process.
- Understanding of: cloud identity, access, certificates., and keys.

**BONUS POINTS**  

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools.
- SaaS Selling experience.
- CSP Certifications.
- Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks.

**Benefits** 

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location. 

**Health & Welfare Benefits** 

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation.

# Application Engineer

### Tel Aviv | CTO

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

We’re looking for an **Application Engineer** to join the CTO team and spread the power of Wiz. In this role, you will focus on building internal tools, automating workflows, and enabling data-driven decision-making. You’ll collaborate with internal stakeholders to solve technical challenges, improve processes, and deliver scalable solutions. We’re particularly interested in candidates who have a deep understanding of designing and implementing tools and solutions for internal teams.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Design, develop, and maintain internal tools and automation systems.
- Collaborate with internal teams to identify inefficiencies and deliver technical solutions.
- Automate repetitive tasks and improve workflows across the organization.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- 4+ years of experience writing code in a high-level programming language (e.g., **Python**, **C#**, **C/C++**, or **Go, TypeScript**).
- Proficiency in **SQL** for data analysis, reporting, and driving data-driven decisions.
- Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams.
- Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control (e.g., Git).
- Knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., CI/CD, Docker).
- Excellent communication skills and a stakeholder-focused mindset.

**ADVANTAGE**

- Background in customer-facing roles (e.g., support engineering, customer engineering) with experience designing and implementing tools for those systems.
- Experience growing into tool development from within customer-focused teams.

# Senior Solutions Engineer, Perth

### Remote - Australia | SE

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

As a **Senior Solutions Engineer**, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional **Manager,** **Solutions Engineering**. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
- Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards,  product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
- Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
- Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
- Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meet-ups, and industry events.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
- Mastered the technical sales process
- Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
- Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
- Must be based in Perth and have the ability to travel up to 40% of the time (to local and regional clients)
- Cloud security experience
- AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
- Network engineering experience
- Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
- Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
- Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys

**BONUS POINTS:**

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools
- SaaS experience
- Awareness of the CI/CD process
- Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code

# Senior Security Analyst - SaaS Applications

### Remote - USA | Corporate Security

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

We’re seeking an experienced Senior Security Analyst to assess, monitor, and improve the security configuration and risk posture of our SaaS applications. This role will work closely with IT, Security, and Business teams to ensure compliance with security best practices, regulatory requirements, and internal policies. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of cloud-based SaaS environments, security frameworks, and risk assessment methodologies. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Evaluate the security configuration, access controls, and risk posture of SaaS applications used across the organization. Secure single-sign on platforms and enforce strong access controls across SaaS and in-house systems.
- Implement and maintain continuous monitoring processes to detect misconfigurations, access anomalies, and potential security threats.
- Assist in compliance audits and security certifications by providing necessary documentation and technical insights.
- Work with IT and business stakeholders to integrate security controls into SaaS procurement and governance processes.
- Stay up to date with emerging SaaS security threats, trends, and regulatory changes to enhance the security posture of the organization.
- Conduct security assessments, gap analyses, and risk evaluations for new and existing SaaS applications.
- Monitor third-party risk exposure, reviewing vendor security practices, data protection measures, and incident response plans.
- Establish and document security requirements and best practices for SaaS onboarding, configuration, and lifecycle management.
- Work to automate processes to streamline and work more efficiently as we continue to grow.
- Collaborate and build relationships with multiple teams throughout the organization, including IT, software engineering, and DevOps.
- Influence Wiz's internal security strategy, to develop and execute security initiatives to meet our objectives, and to define the criteria and measurements that we use to assess our progress.

 

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING** 

- 5+ years of experience in the following areas:
  - Identity, authentication, and access management
  - Saas Application Integration and configuration management
  - Performing security and configuration assessments
  - Working knowledge of compliance standards and risk mitigation

- Experience securing key enterprise systems, including e-mail and communications, developer tools, customer relationship management, and back-office functions
- Strong problem-solving abilities
- Experience working with remote, globally distributed teams
- Demonstrated proficiency in working with cross-functional teams, including IT, Security, GRC and other business owners

  

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS** 

- Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field and / or candidates with equivalent job experience in lieu of a degree
- Proven experience in SaaS application integration and secure configuration management
- Experience working in organizations that develop software and / or operate managed infrastructure and technology services for their own customers
- Experience working in organizations that develop and operate Software as a Service
- Basic scripting skills in Python, PowerShell or Bash
- Information Security and Cloud-Relevant certifications are preferred

 

*Applicants must have the legal right to work in the country where the position is based, without the need for visa sponsorship. This role does not offer visa sponsorship.*

#LI-Remote 

**Benefits** 

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location. 

**Health & Welfare Benefits** 

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation. 

The annual base salary range for this full-time position is listed below.

US Base Pay Range

$152,000—$209,000 USD

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

**SUMMARY**

As a Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional Enterprise Solutions Engineering Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

**LOCATION:**

**The ideal candidate will be based in Chicago, IL or St. Louis, MO**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

- Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
- Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards,  product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
- Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
- Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
- Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meetups,  and industry events.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
- Mastered the technical sales process
- Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
- Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
- Ability to travel
- Cloud security experience
- AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
- Network engineering experience
- Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
- Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
- Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys

**BONUS POINTS:**

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools
- SaaS experience
- Awareness of the CI/CD process
- Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code

*Applicants must have the legal right to work in the country where the position is based, without the need for visa sponsorship. This role does not offer visa sponsorship.*

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation.

As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven [track record of success](https://www.g2.com/products/wiz-wiz/reviews) and a culture that values world-class talent.  

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY** 

We’re seeking a highly collaborative and Strategic Partner Manager to lead and grow our Public Sector engagements with Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud, and collaborate with our Public Sector Partner Eco-System. This individual will drive scalable, joint go-to-market motions across the Public Sector landscape by aligning with CSPs, Federal and SLED (State, Local, and Education) partners, and internal sales and marketing teams. 

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**

**Partner Planning & GTM Strategy** 

- Evangelize the Wiz value proposition and "Better Together" story to assigned CSP and Public Sector partners.
- Build joint strategic partnership plans, including practice development, co-selling motions, and industry-aligned GTM strategies.
- Identify and activate programs and initiatives through CSP Public Sector partner organizations to drive pipeline and revenue growth.
- Develop scalable sales engagement plans aligned with the CSP’s, and help drive cloud marketplace transactions (e.g., AWS Marketplace).
- Integrate CSP and traditional Public Sector partners into GTM efforts, supporting demand gen, thought leadership, partner enablement, and marketing campaigns.
- Lead Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), Executive Briefings (EBCs), and joint planning sessions with partners and internal stakeholders.

**Partner Management** 

- Support partners in executing joint campaigns, co-branded activities, and partner marketing efforts with cross-functional teams (Field Marketing, Channel, Sales).
- Drive pipeline growth through active opportunity mapping, deal registration, and co-sell execution.
- Provide hands-on support for MDF requests, incentive usage, and partner program compliance.
- Connect partner services capabilities with opportunity-specific needs to create impactful, cloud-focused customer solutions.

**Field & Sales Collaboration** 

- Collaborate with the Wiz CSP Global Alliances, regional partner managers, sales, etc. across the Public Sector, ensuring alignment in executive vision, technical capabilities, and marketing initiatives with CSP’s.
- Facilitate opportunity alignment between field sellers and partner ecosystems, including sourcing, co-selling, and cloud solution selling.
- Coordinate internal Wiz teams (Partner Marketing, Field Sales, Enablement) to execute joint partner plans.

**Performance Tracking & Enablement** 

- Maintain accurate records of partner contributions using Salesforce and CSP pipeline portals.
- Monitor KPIs such as certifications, sourced revenue, pipeline, and solution launches.
- Create and share customer success stories, case studies, and field-facing win reports.
- Represent Wiz at regional and CSP-hosted events, evangelizing joint wins and future potential.

 

**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**

- 7+ years of experience in GTM roles within SaaS organizations.
- 5+ years of experience managing CSP partnerships (AWS, Azure, GCP) with a focus on Public Sector.
- Proven relationships and GTM success with FED/SLED partners.
- Deep knowledge of cloud marketplaces and procurement processes in Public Sector.
- Familiarity with partner lifecycle management, co-selling, and SaaS partner program execution.
- Proficiency with Salesforce (SFDC), Tackle.io, and pipeline management tools.
- Highly organized, process-driven, and results-oriented.
- Strong communicator with experience leading cross-functional partner initiatives.

  

**Benefits** 

Wiz offers a competitive package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Below provides a description of our current benefits for employees in the US. Specific benefits may vary by location. 

**Health & Welfare Benefits** 

- Medical, dental and vision insurance
- Home Office Setup reimbursement
- Flexible Spending Accounts
- Monthly Connectivity reimbursement
- Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

**Financial Benefits** 

- Short- and Long-term Disability Insurance
- Life & Accident Insurance
- 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (with employer match)

**Time Off** 

- Flexible paid time off + 11 paid holidays
- Paid leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical and bereavement leave

**Compensation** 

Starting compensation will be determined based on various factors, including but not limited to, the candidate's job-related experience, skills and geographic location. Your Talent Partner can share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process. 

This role is eligible to participate in Wiz’s equity plan and may also include incentive compensation. 

The annual base salary range for this full-time position is listed below.

US Base Pay Range

$203,000—$227,500 USD

### London, UK | RevOps

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the [fastest-growing startup ever,](https://www.wiz.io/blog/100m-arr-in-18-months-wiz-becomes-the-fastest-growing-software-company-ever) Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 45% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

**SUMMARY**

Our Go-To-Market (GTM) Analytics team plays a critical role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our organization. As Wiz continues to scale at an extraordinary rate, the need for actionable insights and data-driven strategies has never been greater.

We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join the GTM Analytics team. In this role, you will act as the key Analytics business partner for the Sales & Sales Enablement organizations, driving decision-making by owning key dashboards, delivering ad-hoc analysis, and providing insights that directly impact Sales effectiveness and growth strategies. This role will be instrumental in helping the Sales & Sales Enablement teams harness data to make smarter, faster, and more strategic decisions.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

- Serve as a primary point of contact for all data insights within the Sales & Sales Enablement organizations, working closely with Sales Leaders, analytics, and operations teams to drive alignment, inform strategy, and deliver impactful insights.
- Define, monitor, and refine Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure success, while providing ad-hoc, actionable insights based on a deep understanding of both data and the Sales & Sales Enablement environments.
- Continuously enhance and optimize dashboards and data sources, improving speed, accuracy, and accessibility to ensure data-driven decisions are made quickly and effectively across the organizations.
- Partner with IT to ensure a robust data infrastructure that maintains the highest standards of data quality, accessibility, and reliability for generating actionable insights.
- Collaborate with Finance and Sales to maintain consistency in data definitions and calculations, ensuring cohesive reporting and decision-making across departments.
- Represent the 'Data' function in cross-functional initiatives, ensuring data-driven insights support new projects and that the data infrastructure is equipped for evolving needs.

**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**

- 3-4+ years of relevant experience in data analytics/operations
- Ability to confidently present complex analysis and models to senior and executive stakeholders, distilling technical findings into clear and actionable insights.
- Passion for all things data, with advanced proficiency in tools such as spreadsheets, SQL databases, and Tableau, and a track record of turning large datasets into concise, actionable summaries.
- Strong understanding of building scalable visualizations and models in a fast-growing organization, ensuring insights are easily accessible and adaptable to evolving needs.

**SUMMARY**

We’re looking for a **Manager, Partner Solutions Architecture – EMEA** to join us in spreading the power of Wiz. In this role, you will report to the Sr. Director, Partner Success and Services and work alongside a team of Wizards focused on understanding the technical business needs of our largest partners.As a player-coach, you will lead and mentor a team of Partner Solutions Architects while remaining hands-on with Wiz and cloud security technologies. You will partner closely with the EMEA Partner Sales leadership to align technical activities with strategic business goals, ensuring our partners maximize their success with Wiz.

You will also collaborate with peer leaders in AMER and APJ to drive global consistency across our partner ecosystem. We are passionate about a robust partner-led GTM strategy and helping our partners build thriving practices around our technology.  
At Wiz, we are customer-obsessed and deeply committed to enabling our partners to deliver exceptional customer value. This role is a unique opportunity to lead, build structure, and drive impact in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

- **Lead and manage** a regional team of Partner Solutions Architects focused on activating and supporting strategic partnerships across EMEA.
- **Coach, mentor, and develop** your team—helping them grow both technically and professionally, while ensuring they stay focused on core strategic initiatives.
- **Act as a trusted technical advisor** to strategic partners, helping them build security services practices around Wiz and align with their GTM strategy.
- **Work hands-on with Wiz**—demonstrating the platform, providing technical guidance, and supporting your team.
- **Partner with sales and product teams** to drive operational excellence, improve efficiency, and ensure technical alignment with broader partner strategy.
- **Measure and report partner impact**, ensuring our partners successfully drive customer adoption of Wiz.
- **Solve complex challenges** related to team capacity, regional constraints, and partner engagement, ensuring our PSAs remain productive and focused.
- **Champion a customer-first mindset**, ensuring that everything we do ultimately drives value for end customers through our partners.

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING**

- **Proven track record of leading and coaching technical teams**—ideally within a partner, pre-sales, or solutions engineering environment.
- **Hands-on experience in cloud security**—with hands on experience with AWS, Azure, and/or GCP.
- **Strong technical expertise** in cloud-native security, infrastructure, networking, operating systems, virtual machines, and containers.
- **Experience influencing director-level partner stakeholders**, aligning technical strategy with business objectives.
- **Ability to build structure in a fast-moving startup**—bringing a steady hand while thriving in a dynamic, evolving environment.
- **A customer-centric approach**, ensuring partner engagements drive real value for end customers.
- **Creative problem-solving skills**, with the ability to navigate challenges related to team capacity, language barriers, and competing priorities.

**BONUS POINTS**

- Experience with traditional CSPM tools and/or cloud infrastructure security.
- Technical SaaS selling experience.
- Awareness of CI/CD processes and DevOps methodologies.
- Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform, CloudFormation).
